benchmark_details.name: Factuality-Weighted Score (FWS) for Watermarking Evaluation
benchmark_details.overview: We propose a medical-focused evaluation workflow that jointly assesses factual accuracy and coherence using FWS, a composite metric prioritizing factual accuracy in watermarking methods for medical texts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable framework for evaluating watermarking methods in medical domains by emphasizing factual integrity in generated texts.

data.size: 200 question-answer pairs from HealthQA, various texts from MeQSum
data.annotation: Annotated using human evaluation and automatic metrics

methodology.calculation: FWS is calculated by emphasizing factual accuracy over coherence based on a weighted formula.
methodology.interpretation: Higher FWS indicates better factual integrity in the generated text.
methodology.baseline_results: Current watermarking methods face notable factuality degradation despite high detection capabilities.
methodology.validation: Validated through correlation analysis with human evaluations.
